issues.description: The problem statement and template expect a no-argument method messageOnRide(), but the solution’s Rideable interface and implementing classes define messageOnRide(String equipment) with a parameter. This parameter mismatch will prevent calls like r.messageOnRide() (as shown in Main.java) from compiling and conflicts with the UML/spec.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the specification by changing Rideable.messageOnRide to have no parameters (messageOnRide():String) and updating all implementations (Pig, Seal) accordingly, so calls to r.messageOnRide() compile.

issues.description: The method messageOnRide is specified in the problem statement and used in the template (e.g., Main.java calls r.messageOnRide() with no arguments), but in the solution the Rideable interface and its implementations declare messageOnRide(String equipment), introducing a parameter that mismatches the expected zero-argument signature and breaks student code mapping.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution to the problem by removing the String parameter from messageOnRide. Change the Rideable interface and its implementations (Pig, Seal) to declare and override messageOnRide():String, and adjust implementations to return exactly "Riding on [Animal Type] [name]".
